Mental Health Crisis Text Line: Text PA to 74174

The National Suicide Prevention Lifeline: 1-800-273-TALK (8255)

I will continue to work with all of my colleagues to ultimately put forth and pass into law legislation that strengthens our economy for all Pennsylvanians and Americans.

(6/6)

While no conversation is more important than the responsible and effective use of taxpayer funds, it's time to roll up our sleeves and get this across the finish line.

(5/6)

Our vote tonight will allow both sides additional time to complete talks about everything from veterans benefits to small business relief to infrastructure improvements and more.

(4/6)

The bottom line is this: we need a short-term agreement to fund vital government services while we finalize a full funding framework, but I'm deeply frustrated by our progress so far.

(3/6)

This is our third continuing resolution, and this too-often traveled path of financial uncertainty and unpredictability makes our federal agencies weaker and our country less safe.

(2/6)

My thoughts on today's vote to pass a continuing resolution:

This vote is the product of bipartisan, bicameral negotiations to fund our government through March 11. But just because legislation is bipartisan and bicameral doesn't mean that it is good for our country.

üßµ(1/6)

And follow along with us as we take each Monday of #BlackHistoryMonth to spotlight modern African American artists in our community!

(4/4)

Many great Black artists have called our community home, including: musician Frank Scott, curator Frank Gilyard, poet Langston Hughes, painter Horace Pippin,
and painter Ida Ella Jones‚Äîto name a few.

(3/4)

African American Art incorporates cultural traditions and influences from across the globe to tell uniquely beautiful stories.  These traditions in our country span more that four centuries. 

(2/4)

Join us this #BlackHistoryMonth as we explore Black History through artists past and present.

African American Art helps us understand the vital history, culture, and lives of valuable members of our community. It is a source of inspiration, reflections and joy.

üßµ(1/4)

These are just a few of the bipartisan bills we passed last week. 

I promise I will continue to work across the aisle to address the needs of our communities and I will be sure to update you on this important work.
.@USRepKCastor's PREVENT HPV Cancers Act, which aims to help prevent HPV-related cancers, passed without opposition.
.@michaelcburgess' Social Determinants of Health Data Analysis Act, that would improve health data collection efforts, passed 399-28.
.@RepTerriSewell's Maternal Vaccination Act, that would strengthen efforts to safely immunize pregnant and postpartum mothers, passed without opposition.
